The Important Work at Home.--If married men go into the work, leaving their wives to care for the children at home, the wife and mother is doing fully as great and important a work as is the husband and father. While one is in the missionary field, the other is a home missionary, whose cares and anxieties and burdens frequently far exceed those of the husband and father. The mother's work is a solemn and important one,--to mold the minds and fashion the 
                                                                           677
characters of her children, to train them for usefulness here, and to fit them for the future immortal life.
